docs.lead_paragraph: For many adults, television is a version of the window on whose sill one props a pillow, folds one's arms and leans out to watch the passing scene. But the views through this particular glass change at a finger's touch, and range from the fact of a news conference to the fiction in which half the men are doctors and all the women look airbrushed. Though the border between real and unreal is often blurred, most of the spectators know the difference - including those who wept when Luke and Laura finally married.
